result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas L. Hanson

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas L. Hanson not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Thomas L. Hanson.   Defendant has fractured his hip and is too groggy to appear by phone.  State would not object to a reschedule.  Need letter from Doctor verifying medical issues within 7 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:32 PM Defendant Thomas L. Hanson not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Thomas L. Hanson.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant could not get a ride.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 14, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

03:59 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Thomas L. Hanson, appeared by audio with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 26, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
appeared in court, signature bond set

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.   Defendant shall have no abusive, violent or otherwise disorderly contact with M.J.M.

01:19 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Thomas L. Hanson appeared, pro se.  Warrant cancelled.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:50 pm.

11:32 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant's Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared.  He called and said his ride fell through, the office tried to call him back and gave the person who answered that he could appear by video, he never logged in and the State is asking for a warrant.  Court can issue their arrest warrant.
